cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 200 miles SSE of Lake Charles Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest, then turning north-northwest toward the upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coast, with inland track across northwest Louisiana and Arkansas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Cameron/Johnson Bayou, LA (just south of Lake Charles)

weather_observation.watch_coast: East of Intracoastal City to west of Morgan City, Louisiana (Hurricane Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: San Luis Pass, TX to Intracoastal City, LA (Hurricane Warning – includes Lake Charles area)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-west Gulf Coast from Sea Rim State Park, TX to Intracoastal City, LA including Calcasieu and Sabine Lakes
weather_observation.wind: Catastrophic, sustained hurricane-force winds likely (≥115 mph with higher gusts) during eyewall passage.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening surge 15–20 ft above ground possible in Calcasieu Lake and adjacent coast, capable of penetrating up to 30 miles inland.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches with isolated 15 inches, producing flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes, destructive waves, dangerous rip currents, prolonged port closure and debris hazards.
